title: Prevailing dry weather conditions expected to change from Friday
byline: The prevailing dry weather conditions are expected to change from Friday (23), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Government Radiologic Technologists to begin token strike at 8am
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association has decided to launch a 24-hour token strike at 8.00 a.m. in all hospitals across the island.

title: Schools to reopen today
byline: The second phase of the first school term for the 2026 academic year in government and government-approved private schools is scheduled to commence today (21).

title: PM Harini holds discussions with ADB President in Davos
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya has held discussions with the President and Chairperson of the Board of Directors of the Asian Development Bank (ADB), Masato Kanda in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Ex-Minister Nandana Gunathilake to be laid to rest today
byline: The final rites of former Minister, late Nandana Gunathilake will be performed at the Wadduwa Public Playground today.

title: OpenAI rolls out age prediction on ChatGPT
byline: OpenAI on Tuesday said it is rolling out age prediction on ChatGPT globally, to determine whether an account is likely owned by a minor, as the artificial intelligence startup prepares to allow adult content on the popular chatbot.

title: Driver killed and 37 people injured in Barcelona train crash
byline: A train driver has been killed and at least 37 people injured, five seriously, after a commuter train derailed and crashed near Barcelona just days on from a two-train collision in southern Spain on Sunday.

title: Europe to suspend approval of US trade deal as global markets fall
byline: The European Parliament is planning to suspend approval of the US trade deal agreed in July, according to sources close to its international trade committee.

title: Nuwara Eliya records lowest temperature at 7.4°C today
byline: The lowest temperature recorded in Sri Lanka today (21) was 7.4°C, observed at the Nuwara Eliya weather station during the early hours of the morning, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Sabina Yousaf departs to US to represent Sri Lanka at 41st Mrs. World Pageant
byline: Mrs. Sri Lanka World Sabina Yousaf has departed from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) early this morning (21) to represent Sri Lanka at the 41st Mrs. World Pageant, which will be held in the United States.

title: Country’s rulers are obligated to protect Buddhism: Ex-President Ranil
byline: Rulers of the country are obligated to protect Buddhism, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has stressed.

title: Three dead in separate road accidents
byline: Three individuals have died in three separate road accidents that occurred in Laggala, Badulla and Nawagamuwa yesterday.

title: Donald Trump’s approval rating takes a hit in his first year back in office
byline: President Donald Trump marked the one‑year anniversary of his return to the White House on Tuesday with a wide-ranging news conference that meandered from crime mugshots and immigration raids to the Nile River, Nobel Peace Prize and biker gangs.

title: Close associate of foreign-based criminal arrested with firearm
byline: An individual has been arrested by the Homicide and Organized Crime Investigation Division for the possession of a firearm and a locally manufactured hand grenade.

title: Gold crosses $4,800 for the first time as US, EU spar over Greenland
byline: Gold prices surged to a record high above $4,800 per ounce on Wednesday, buoyed by safe-haven demand and a softer dollar as U.S. President Donald Trump’s pursuit of Greenland threatened to reignite a trade war with Europe and upend the NATO alliance.

title: Over 30,000 individuals subjected to inspection during special police operation
byline: A total of 652 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (20).

title: Individual arrested with 61kg of ICE valued at Rs. 900 million in Nittambuwa
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of over 61kg of crystal methamphetamine (ICE) in Pinnagolla Estate, Nittambuwa.

title: High-benefit pension scheme for fishermen introduced
byline: A high-benefit pension scheme for fishermen has been introduced by the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources in collaboration with the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board.

title: Opposition moves motion to appoint Select Committee on Cyclone Ditwah preparedness
byline: The opposition today (21) moved a motion to appoint a Select Committee of Parliament to conduct a comprehensive study on the lack of preparedness to face Cyclone Ditwah and report to Parliament and submit its proposals and recommendations in that regard.

title: Man who assassinated former Japanese prime minister gets life in prison
byline: A Japanese court sentenced a man who admitted assassinating former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to life imprisonment on Wednesday, according to NHK public television.

title: Trump’s plane lands safely after ‘minor electrical issue,’ Davos trip to continue
byline: US President Donald Trump’s Air Force One landed safely at Joint Base Andrews near Washington to change aircraft Tuesday night after crew on his initial flight identified “a minor electrical issue” shortly after takeoff.

title: Man arrested for robbing Rs. 1.5 million by intimidating a woman in Millaniya
byline: An individual has been arrested for allegedly robbing Rs. 1.5 million by intimidating a woman in Millaniya, police said.

title: IMF Chief reaffirms support for Sri Lanka’s economic recovery
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has reaffirmed its continuous support to Sri Lanka’s economic recovery.

title: Suspect arrested for allegedly showing obscene material to minor schoolgirls
byline: An individual has been arrested in connection with allegations that obscene video material was shown to minor schoolgirls on multiple occasions.

title: Air quality worsens in several cities: NBRO
byline: Air quality in several cities in Sri Lanka has deteriorated to unhealthy levels this morning owing to various factors, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has stated.

title: Speaker endorses Colombo Port City Economic Commission (Amendment) Bill
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the Colombo Port City Economic Commission (Amendment) Bill.

title: Two Indian fishing boats seized for poaching in northern waters
byline: A total of seven Indian fishermen have been arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters off Kovilan, Jaffna.

title: Tourist helicopter goes missing near volcano in Japan
byline: A sightseeing helicopter carrying three people has gone missing near Mount Aso, one of Japan’s most active volcanoes.

title: Tamil Nadu CM writes to Indian Govt to secure the release of all fishermen in Sri Lankan custody
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Wednesday (21) has written to the External Affairs Minister of India S Jaishankar, urging him to utilise appropriate diplomatic channels to prevent the arrests of fishermen from Tamil Nadu by the Sri Lankan Navy and to secure the immediate release of all detained fishermen and their fishing boats.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation increases to 2.9% in December 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has increased to 2.9% in December 2025, compared to 2.4% in November 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Namal accuses Govt of attempting to undermine AG Dept. and judiciary
byline: The government is attempting to intimidate the Attorney General’s Department and the judiciary in order to achieve its political objectives, the National Organiser of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has accused.

title: South Korea’s ex-PM Han sentenced to 23 years in prison for aiding insurrection
byline: South Korea’s former Prime Minister Han Duck-soo on Wednesday was sentenced to 23 years in prison for aiding and abetting the insurrection of the impeached former President Yoon Suk-yeol.

title: Special exposition of sacred corporeal relics of Lord Buddha at Gangaramaya Temple
byline: The veneration of the Sacred Relics, which are due to be brought to Sri Lanka with the intervention of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and with the full patronage of the government of India, will be held at the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo for seven days from 4 to 11 February.

title: Sri Lanka seeks long-term investment in tourism sector: PM Harini
byline: Sri Lanka welcome long-term investment in the tourism sector, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has emphasized.

title: Death certificates issued to 525 Cyclone Ditwah victims: Minister
byline: Death certificates have been issued for 525 individuals who lost their lives due to landslides and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah, the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, Chandana Abeyratne stated.

title: Search operation launched in Kalu Ganga for missing accountant
byline: A search and rescue operation has been initiated in the Kalu Ganga by divers and Sri Lanka Navy lifesaving personnel following information received indicating that an accountant may have jumped into the river from the Kalutara Bridge.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu agrees to join Trump’s Board of Peace
byline: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Wednesday he had agreed to join U.S. President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace, after his office earlier criticized makeup of the board’s executive committee.

title: 189 wildlife and forest-related complaints received via ‘1995’ hotline - Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Environment reports that a total of 189 public complaints related to wildlife and forest-related offences have been received to date.

title: ICC rejects BCB’s request to relocate T20 WC matches
byline: The ICC Board has rejected the Bangladesh Cricket Board’s request to relocate their 2026 T20 World Cup matches out of India.

title: President proposes legal mechanism to address education reform challenges
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated that the Government is taking steps to establish a comprehensive mechanism, supported by an appropriate legal framework, to bring together university academics, experts and all relevant parties to address issues arising during the implementation of education reforms.

title: Chairman of NPP-controlled Habaraduwa PS steps down
byline: Harsha Manoj Gardiya Punchihewa, Chairman of the Habaraduwa Pradeshiya Sabha, which is under the control of the National People’s Power (NPP), has resigned from his position.

title: Netflix updates Warner Bros bid to all-cash offer
byline: Netflix has updated its offer for Warner Bros Discovery’s streaming and film business and will pay completely in cash - as it looks to fend off rival Paramount Skydance in pursuit of the Hollywood studio.

title: Dengue cases surge in Batticaloa following floods and monsoon rains
byline: The Regional Director of Health Services (RDHS) in Batticaloa has stated that dengue fever is spreading rapidly across the district following the recent floods and monsoon rainfall.

title: Trump in Davos speech says he won’t use force to acquire Greenland
byline: President Donald Trump insisted he won’t use force to acquire Greenland in a speech at the World Economic Forum, where he said that the U.S. is booming but Europe is “not heading in the right direction.”

title: SLAF deploys 11th aviation contingent to Central African Republic
byline: The 11th Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Aviation Contingent assigned to the United Nations Peacekeeping Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) departed Sri Lanka this morning (21).

title: ICC T20 World Cup trophy tour launched in Sri Lanka under President’s patronage
byline: The official tour showcasing the ICC T20 World Cup trophy, which will be jointly hosted by India and Sri Lanka in 2026, was formally inaugurated today (21) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: EU lawmakers stall US trade deal in protest over Greenland
byline: The European Parliament has decided to suspend its work on the European Union’s trade deal with the United States in protest at U.S. President Donald Trump’s demands to acquire Greenland and threats of tariffs on European allies who oppose his plan.
